metadata.title: CVE-2023-49935 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in SchedMD Slurm 23.02.x and 23.11.x. There isIncorrect Access Control because of a slurmd Message Integrity Bypass. Anattacker can reuse root-level authentication tokens during interaction withthe slurmd process. This bypasses the RPC message hashes that protectagainst undesired MUNGE credential reuse. The fixed versions are 23.02.7and 23.11.1.

criterions.comment: slurm-llnl package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
